intro: Justicia ulugurica, commonly known as the Uluguru justicia, is a flowering plant native to the Uluguru Mountains in Tanzania. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in inflorescences at the ends of branches. Justicia ulugurica is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native region and plays a role in local ecosystems.
